result.execSummary:
The defendant Braven Lee Martinek-Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Braven Lee Martinek-Miller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Braven Lee Martinek-Miller was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Braven Lee Martinek-Miller was found guilty of Violate Absolute Sobriety Law. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees.**
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges, Drug Surcharge.**
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.**
**Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.**
May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to termination of DE's probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Braven Lee Martinek-Miller

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

2:23 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Braven Lee Martinek-Miller in court.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Noonan in court for Braven Lee Martinek-Miller. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM572/22TR3733-3734. Matter is resolved and agreement placed on the record.

22TR3733-3734: On motion of the State, TR cases are dismissed.

22CM572: State moves to amend count 3 to ordinance Violate Absolute Sobriety. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1 and amended count 3; found guilty by the court. On motion of the State, count 2 is dismissed. 

Amended count 3: Court imposes $811.50 total fine/costs, 90 days to pay, or 16 days KCJ/work crew.

Count 1: Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 6 months w/conditions. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. No sentence credit if revoked. Court costs, Drug surcharge and DNA surcharge ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the cost; written notice provided to defendant. Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation. Expungement hearing to be scheduled.

Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

8:49 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for the County and State of Wisconsin. Defendant Braven Lee Martinek-Miller in court.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Noonan in court for Braven Lee Martinek-Miller. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM572/22TR3733/22TR3734. Attorney Noonan is requesting an adjournment for reasons set forth on the record. The State does not object. Court adjourns. TR cases continue to trail 22CM572.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Minutes:  9:29am.  22CM572/22TR3733/3734.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Daniel Tombasco appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person along w/Atty Kevin Noonan.  Defense counsel requests plea date; offer just received today.  No objection by the State.  Plea hrg set for 9/21/22 @ 8:45am.  TR files are trailing.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia

03:02 PM  
  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.  $350  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).    jk
